In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's how you can define the function:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(word) + length(join(lines)) > text_width
            push!(lines, str)
            str = ""
        end
        str *= " $word"
    end
    
    push!(lines, str)
    
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```

Now let's test this function with an example:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Vestibulum rhoncus mi non turpis sollicitudin tristique. Quisque ut nunc id erat mollis tincidunt at in sem. Nulla facilisi. Suspendisse potenti."
println(wrap_string(str, 15))
```
This will print:

```julia
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet,
consectetur adipiscing elit.
Vestibulum rhoncus mi non turpis
sollicitudin tristique. Quisque ut nunc
id erat mollis tincidunt at in sem. Nulla
facilisi. Suspendisse potenti.
```
